Posted By: Arachibutyrophobia (9/29/2009 9:42:58 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Particularly ammusing because the search lands were recreated too. First turn: Opponent draws 7, plays search land. You triggered my Archive Trap card!x4: mill for 52. With the 1 card they took with the search land, that makes exactly 60 cards.
  
   
So that's why it's 13 cards, for those who don't know.
  
   
Anyway, you don't need to have 4 in your starting hand. It's basicly an improved [Glimpse the Unthinkable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimpse the Unthinkable).
posts.html:
Particularly ammusing because the search lands were recreated too. First turn: Opponent draws 7, plays search land. You triggered my Archive Trap card!x4: mill for 52. With the 1 card they took with the search land, that makes exactly 60 cards.

So that's why it's 13 cards, for those who don't know.

Anyway, you don't need to have 4 in your starting hand. It's basicly an improved Glimpse the Unthinkable.

posts.post_content: What I like about this is that it can be put in pretty much any deck, whether or not that deck has any Islands. I mean, sure, it's a little risky, but chances are your opponent is going to search his deck at some point while you've got this.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Anyone else think the flavor totally busts in multi-player? "Hah, Jimmy just searched his deck for a land! Take that George!" As in, instead of "if target player does yadda yadda, this spell can be payed for 0, targetting that player," They've got, "as long as someone fits the requirements, anyone can fall in the trap." What?
posts.html:

As in, instead of "if target player does yadda yadda, this spell can be payed for 0, targetting that player," They've got, "as long as someone fits the requirements, anyone can fall in the trap." What?

posts.post_content:
Probably one of the best milling cards ever. If it gets some support in Worldwake, Standard milling may become a possible deck.  
  
And I don't think the flavor is hurt in multiplayer. Anyone can trigger a trap. Ever play D&D? It isn't always the guy who triggers it who gets hurt by it.
posts.html:
